TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi ComputerInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides properties for getting information about the computer's memory, loaded assemblies, name, and operating system.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The properties exposed by the `My.Computer.Info` object return information about the computer from which the application is deployed, as determined at run time. Typically, this data differs from what was available on the development computer.
## Examples This example uses the `My.Computer.Info.AvailablePhysicalMemory` property to display the amount of available physical memory for the computer on which the code runs.
[!code-vb[VbVbalrMyComputer#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_VBCSharp/VbVbalrMyComputer/VB/Class1.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AvailablePhysicalMemory As ULong
public: property System::UInt64 AvailablePhysicalMemory { System::UInt64 get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total amount of free physical memory for the computer.
Docs.value: A containing the number of bytes of free physical memory for the computer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `My.Computer.Info.AvailablePhysicalMemory` property requires Windows XP, Windows 2000 Professional, Windows Server 2003, Windows 2000 Server, or Windows Vista.
## Examples This example uses the `My.Computer.Info.AvailablePhysicalMemory` property to display the amount of available physical memory for the computer on which the code runs.
[!code-vb[VbVbalrMyComputer#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_VBCSharp/VbVbalrMyComputer/VB/Class1.vb#2)]

Docs.exception: The application cannot obtain the memory status.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AvailableVirtualMemory As ULong
public: property System::UInt64 AvailableVirtualMemory { System::UInt64 get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total amount of the computer's free virtual address space.
Docs.value: A containing the number of bytes of the computer's free virtual address space.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `My.Computer.Info.AvailableVirtualMemory` property requires Windows XP, Windows 2000 Professional, Windows Server 2003, Windows 2000 Server, or Windows Vista.
## Examples This example uses the `My.Computer.Info.AvailableVirtualMemory` property to display the amount of available virtual memory for the computer on which the code runs.
[!code-vb[VbVbalrMyComputer#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_VBCSharp/VbVbalrMyComputer/VB/Class1.vb#3)]

Docs.exception: The application cannot obtain the memory status.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property InstalledUICulture As CultureInfo
public: property System::Globalization::CultureInfo ^ InstalledUICulture { System::Globalization::CultureInfo ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the current UI culture installed with the operating system.
Docs.value: A object represents the UI culture installed on the computer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `My.Computer.Info.InstalledUICulture` property has the same behavior as the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.InstalledUICulture%2A> property.
In a localized operating system, such as Japanese Windows 2000 Professional, this property returns the culture of the operating system.
## Examples This example uses the `My.Computer.Info.InstalledUICulture` property to display the name of the operating system's UI culture.
[!code-vb[VbVbalrMyComputer#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_VBCSharp/VbVbalrMyComputer/VB/Class1.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OSFullName As String
public: property System::String ^ OSFullName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the full operating system name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property returns detailed information about the operating system name if Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) is installed on the computer. Otherwise, this property returns the same string as the `My.Computer.Info.OSPlatform` property, which provides less detailed information than WMI can provide.
## Examples This example uses the `My.Computer.Info.OSFullName` property to display the name of the computer's operating system.
[!code-vb[VbVbalrMyComputer#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_VBCSharp/VbVbalrMyComputer/VB/Class1.vb#5)]

Docs.exception: The calling code does not have full trust.
Docs.permission: Controls the ability to access files and folders. Associated enumeration: .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OSPlatform As String
public: property System::String ^ OSPlatform { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the platform identifier for the operating system of the computer.
Docs.value: A containing the platform identifier for the operating system of the computer, chosen from the member names of the enumeration.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `My.Computer.Info.OSPlatform` property provides functionality similar to the <xref:System.OperatingSystem.Platform%2A> property of the object returned by the <xref:System.Environment.OSVersion%2A> property.
## Examples This example uses the `My.Computer.Info.OSPlatform` property to display the platform of the computer's operating system.
[!code-vb[VbVbalrMyComputer#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_VBCSharp/VbVbalrMyComputer/VB/Class1.vb#6)]

Docs.exception: The application cannot obtain the operating-system platform information.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OSVersion As String
public: property System::String ^ OSVersion { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the version of the computer's operating system.
Docs.value: A containing the current version number of the operating system.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `My.Computer.Info.OSVersion` property formats the version as "major.minor.build.revision".
The `My.Computer.Info.OSVersion` property provides functionality similar to the <xref:System.OperatingSystem.Version%2A> property of the object returned by the <xref:System.Environment.OSVersion%2A> property.
## Examples This example uses the `My.Computer.Info.OSVersion` property to display the version of the computer's operating system.
[!code-vb[VbVbalrMyComputer#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_VBCSharp/VbVbalrMyComputer/VB/Class1.vb#7)]

Docs.exception: The application cannot obtain the operating-system version information.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TotalPhysicalMemory As ULong
public: property System::UInt64 TotalPhysicalMemory { System::UInt64 get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total amount of physical memory for the computer.
Docs.value: A containing the number of bytes of physical memory for the computer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `My.Computer.Info.TotalPhysicalMemory` property requires Windows XP, Windows 2000 Professional, Windows Server 2003, Windows 2000 Server, or Windows Vista..
## Examples This example uses the `My.Computer.Info.TotalPhysicalMemory` property to display the total amount of physical memory for the computer on which the code runs.
[!code-vb[VbVbalrMyComputer#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_VBCSharp/VbVbalrMyComputer/VB/Class1.vb#8)]

Docs.exception: The application cannot obtain the memory status.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TotalVirtualMemory As ULong
public: property System::UInt64 TotalVirtualMemory { System::UInt64 get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total amount of virtual address space available for the computer.
Docs.value: A containing the number of bytes of virtual address space available for the computer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `My.Computer.Info.TotalVirtualMemory` property requires Windows XP, Windows 2000 Professional, Windows Server 2003, Windows 2000 Server, or Windows Vista..
## Examples This example uses the `My.Computer.Info.TotalVirtualMemory` property to display the total amount of virtual memory for the computer on which the code runs.
[!code-vb[VbVbalrMyComputer#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_VBCSharp/VbVbalrMyComputer/VB/Class1.vb#9)]

Docs.exception: The application cannot obtain the memory status.
